answers.answer: How high is your Blood Pressure? Has doctor recommended bp  meds?   Preeclampsia is very dangerous condition so thats why doc is concerned.

It wasn't extremely high, he's just concerned bc I'm considered high risk. I go back in two days for recheck. He didn't bring up the possibility pre eclampsia. I've recently started swelling I'm my feet and occasional my hands so he's concerned about that being a sign of increasing blood pressure but I won't really know more till Friday. I've only gained 20lbs and actually considered on the small size but since baby boy been growing on track that want a concern. I just want to spend up the dilation process so I can have him naturally.
Try to rest! Drink a glass of water before you get in the shower and and so try not to stress! Maybe if you can keep your pressure low you'll be okay
So ready for my doctors apt tmr.....
If your body isn't dialting it means its not ready to... And unfortently its not really going to until it is. No matter what you try.

question: So I had abnormal blood work earlier on in my pregnancy not sure why but being that this is my first pregnancy and I'm just 20. It means I'm high risk. So docs been monitoring my closely. Everythings been great baby boy getting bigger everyday already 6lbs 18.5 inches long. And always active. Yesterday I had a doctors apt and my bp was elevated. Doctor says if it doesn't go down baby boy will need to come asap. But I haven't dialated at all. If my bp doesn't go down they'll induce. So I'm wondering what worked best to get you ladies dialated on your own??? He's head down but I haven't dropped yet really. I'd just rather dilate naturally rather than through meds which doc says if the meds don't work then I'll need a c section. However I'm hoping my bp can stay down and everything goes naturally itself but I'm worried a little.
title: 37 weeks with sudden increased blood pressure...need info
